paper_abstract: Let P be a set of n points in R-3, not all in a common plane. We solve a problem of Scott (1970) by showing that the connecting lines of P assume at least 2n - 5 different directions if n is odd and at least 2n - 7 if n is even. The bound for odd n is sharp.
paper_title: Solution of Scott's problem on the number of directions determined by a point set in 3-space
